intro: Elephantopus scaber var. albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflower groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual with a bushy, upright growth habit, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly rough texture. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, open environments.
